projects.title: PizzaMama Django (API-First Backend)
projects.description: API-first backend architecture for a restaurant and pizzeria platform built with Django and Django REST Framework. The project features a modular domain structure, versioned REST APIs, token-based authentication, OpenAPI documentation, and a fully modeled e-commerce order workflow.
features: Custom user model with profile and multi-address support
Versioned REST API architecture (/api/v1/)
Token and session authentication system
Modular domain separation (accounts, products, orders)
Hierarchical product catalog with ingredient management
Order workflow with UUID primary keys and status tracking
Order item snapshot system for historical consistency
Automatic OpenAPI 3 documentation with Swagger UI
Centralized router and scalable API structure
challenges: Designing a scalable API-first architecture
Implementing secure user-scoped data access
Modeling a full e-commerce domain structure
Maintaining strict separation between domain and API layer
learnings: Clean domain modeling before API exposure

projects._comment: THIRD PROJECT – MASTER'S THESIS: MACHINE LEARNING & DATA ANALYSIS ON HETEROGENEOUS COVID DATASET
projects.title: Relationship and Dimensionality Reduction in Heterogeneous Datasets
projects.description: Master's thesis project focused on the application of machine learning techniques for relationship analysis and dimensionality reduction in complex and heterogeneous datasets.
features: Custom Random Forest algorithms
Bootstrap methods for validation
Advanced statistical analysis (p-values, hypothesis testing)
Interactive data visualizations
PCA-based dimensionality reduction
Complete scientific documentation
challenges: Handling complex and heterogeneous datasets
Implementing machine learning algorithms from scratch
Rigorous statistical validation

projects._comment: FOURTH PROJECT: MACHINE LEARNING & DATA ANALYSIS ON THE TITANIC DATASET
projects.title: Titanic Survival Prediction – Machine Learning Analysis
projects.description: Comprehensive machine learning analysis to predict Titanic passenger survival. It includes exploratory data analysis, advanced feature engineering, multiple ML algorithms, ensemble methods, and an interactive Streamlit dashboard.
features: Exploratory data analysis and feature engineering
Multiple ML models with ensemble methods
Hyperparameter tuning with cross-validation
Interactive Streamlit dashboard
Model interpretation and performance evaluation
challenges: Handling missing data while preventing data leakage
Feature engineering using historical domain knowledge
Bias–variance trade-off optimization
Integration of exploratory and predictive pipelines
Ensemble model performance optimization

projects._comment: GDR WEB APP PROJECT – MULTIPLAYER FANTASY ROLE-PLAYING GAME
projects.title: GDR Web App – Fantasy Role Playing Game
projects.description: Multiplayer fantasy role-playing game developed during the 'Python Programmer and Developer' training course. A complete web application that allows players to create characters, explore environments, fight enemies, and manage inventories in an immersive fantasy world.
features: Complete user authentication system
Character creation with multiple playable classes
Dynamic inventory and item management system
Turn-based combat system with game logic rules
Procedural missions and progression system
Modular backend architecture using Flask Blueprints
REST API for game statistics and dashboards
Responsive web interface with Bootstrap 5
challenges: Designing scalable Flask architecture with Blueprints
Managing persistent multiplayer game state
Balancing gameplay logic with performance constraints
learnings: Full-stack web development with Flask and MVC architecture
Backend state management and multi-user application logic
Collaborative development using Git workflows and code reviews
Database modeling and ORM usage for complex applications
Clean code principles and modular software design
Testing and debugging of multi-user web applications
technical_highlights: Robust data validation system using Marshmallow
Real-time dashboards with REST APIs and AJAX

projects._comment: GALAXY RUNNER – 3D SPACE GAME BUILT WITH KIVY
projects.title: Galaxy Runner – 3D Space Tunnel Game
projects.description: High-speed 3D space runner game built with Kivy. Features include dynamic procedural track generation, custom mathematical perspective transformations for realistic visuals, and multi-platform input support for desktop and mobile devices, delivering an immersive tunnel effect.
features: Custom 3D perspective engine based on vanishing point mathematics
Dynamic procedural track generation with intelligent obstacle placement
Smooth cross-platform input handling (desktop and mobile)
Accurate collision detection with procedural obstacles
Modular architecture with clear separation of responsibilities
Optimized real-time rendering at stable 60 FPS
Distance-based scoring system with real-time updates
Complete technical documentation with API reference
challenges: Implementing custom 3D perspective transformation algorithms from scratch
Optimizing rendering performance to achieve stable 60 FPS
Designing a unified cross-platform input system
Managing multiple coordinate systems (world, screen, perspective)
Implementing precise collision detection with procedural geometry
Designing a scalable modular architecture for maintainability
technical_highlights: ~2000+ lines of Python code with complete documentation
Custom 3D mathematical algorithms for realistic perspective
Consistent 60 FPS performance with efficient rendering
Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS)
Professional documentation with full API reference

projects._comment: MRBEAT – PROFESSIONAL DRUM MACHINE BUILT WITH KIVY
projects.title: MrBeat – Professional Drum Machine and Beat Sequencer
projects.description: Professional drum machine for music production built with Kivy and pygame. Features include 16-step multi-track sequencing, a real-time audio engine with safe threading, a professional drum machine interface, and support for extensible sound kits with high-quality 16-bit audio processing.
features: Real-time audio engine built with pygame (44.1kHz, 16-bit)
Sample-accurate multi-track sequencing with precise timing
Low-latency BPM control with real-time updates during playback
Safe multithreading for glitch-free real-time audio processing
Extensible sound kit system with modular track management
Modular architecture separating audio engine and UI layers
Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, macOS, Linux)
Complete technical documentation with API reference
projects.role: Audio Software Engineer and Music Technology Developer
challenges: Migrating from deprecated audio streaming to modern pygame while preserving compatibility
Implementing safe multithreading for real-time audio without race conditions
Reducing audio latency below 10ms for professional music performance
Achieving sample-accurate synchronization between audio engine and UI
Designing a scalable modular architecture for extensible sound kits
Managing memory efficiently for multiple concurrent audio samples
learnings: Advanced real-time audio programming with pygame
Concurrency and safe threading patterns for time-critical systems
Design of modular and scalable audio software architectures
Professional technical documentation and API design

components.name: Professional UI System
components.technology: Kivy responsive design with visual feedback
components.scalability: Adaptive layout for multiple screen sizes

technical_highlights: ~1500+ lines of Python code with complete professional documentation
Safe threading implemented for glitch-free real-time audio
Modular architecture with 10+ specialized files for separation of concerns
Audio performance optimized for professional music production
Cross-platform compatibility tested on Windows, macOS, and Linux
Professional documentation with detailed flowcharts and API reference

projects.title: Python Learning Journey
projects.description: Comprehensive collection of Python projects and exercises from the Udemy course, evolving from v1.0 to v12.0. Includes automation, web scraping, GUI applications, and API integration.
features: 12+ progressive project versions
Automation of repetitive tasks
Web scraping applications
Desktop GUIs with Tkinter/Kivy
External API integration
Detailed documentation of the learning evolution
challenges: Maintaining consistency across versions
Documenting the learning process
Progressively implementing best practices
learnings: Python from beginner to intermediate level
